meanings.definition: A person who behaves obsequiously to those in power.
meanings.sent1: The lickspittle always agreed with the boss, no matter what.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was labeled a lickspittle for constantly flattering the manager.
meanings.sent3: The lickspittle in the office even complimented the boss's terrible tie.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as a lickspittle, always following the leader without question.
meanings.sent5: The lickspittle's constant nodding and smiling made everyone roll their eyes.

meanings.definition: To behave obsequiously to those in power.
meanings.sent1: He would lickspittle his way to a promotion by praising the supervisor endlessly.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to lickspittle, but she felt it was the only way to get ahead.
meanings.sent3: The employee decided to lickspittle to the CEO by bringing coffee every morning.
meanings.sent4: The politician would lickspittle to the voters, promising everything they wanted.
meanings.sent5: The intern would lickspittle to the executives, hoping to be noticed for her efforts.
